mdRecord.dcterms:description: Front facade with wide gallery surrounded by columns

In 1815, it was rebuilt for Thomas Buck Reed (1787â€“1829), who served as the United States Senator from Mississippi from January 28, 1826 to March 4, 1827, and again from March 4, 1829 to November 26, 1829; he was also the son-in-law of plantation owner Isaac Ross (1760-1838). The mansion was known as Reedland. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linden_%28Natchez,_Mississippi%29 [work]
